Headline: Germany’s Votes Are Cast. What Happens Now?
Summary: The country appears headed for a coalition government. But the process of building one could take months.

Headline: Tens of Thousands Mourn Hezbollah’s Former Leader
Summary: Hezbollah supporters gathered to pay tribute to Hassan Nasrallah, the group’s former leader, and Hashem Safieddine, another top official, at a funeral service held months after both were killed by Israel.

Headline: Trump Appointees Fire Hundreds at U.S.A.I.D. Working on Urgent Aid
Summary: The firings added to doubts about whether Secretary of State Marco Rubio, the agency’s acting head, supports lifesaving humanitarian assistance, as he has said he does.

Headline: ‘Terrorist’ Attack at Market in France Leaves One Dead
Summary: The suspect, an Algerian national who was on France’s terrorist watch list, was arrested.

Headline: Pope Francis in Critical Condition After ‘Respiratory Crisis,’ Vatican Says
Summary: The announcement on Saturday evening indicated that Francis’ medical condition had become more complicated since an update from his doctors on Friday.

Headline: Canada’s Hockey Victory Sends a Message to Trump: Hands Off
Summary: The routine friendly bet between leaders of Canada and the United States before hockey games was replaced by taunts and heightened stakes on Thursday.

Headline: The Unabashedly Provocative Youth Driving Germany’s Far Right
Summary: A new band of influencers unafraid of confrontation has helped elevate the Alternative for Germany party to second in pre-election polls.

Headline: What Congo’s President Thinks of Rwanda: A ‘Mania to Be the Apex Predator’
Summary: As vast swaths of Congolese territory are seized by a Rwandan-backed armed group, Congo’s president looks to make a minerals deal with the United States.

Headline: U.S. and Ukraine Appear to Move Closer to Deal for Minerals Amid Leaders’ Public Feud
Summary: President Trump on Friday continued to bash President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine and pressure him for mineral rights.

Headline: It’s Been 5 Years Since Covid Hit. Do You Travel Differently Now?
Summary: The pandemic was declared in March 2020, shutting down travel for months. How did the lockdowns, and then the surge in demand, change the way you travel?

Headline: The Pope Is in a ‘Good Mood’ but ‘Not Out of Danger,’ His Doctors Say
Summary: As the pope enters his second week in a Rome hospital with a lung infection, his physicians said his condition was critical but not immediately life-threatening.

Headline: Gazans Returning Home to Jabaliya Embrace Reopened Market
Summary: A single image of a farmer’s market sprouting back up in devastated northern Gaza tells the story of loss and, perhaps, eventual rebirth.

Headline: When Germany Votes, It Will Be About the Economy
Summary: The country’s competitiveness has stagnated and its once-powerful industries are suffering. Just ask these executives.

Headline: Russia Talks Peace While Troops Threaten New Region in Ukraine
Summary: Moscow’s forces are three miles from Dnipropetrovsk, a province they have never invaded. If they cross in, the advance would be a morale blow to Ukraine and complicate any territorial negotiations.

Headline: U.S. Objects to Calling Russia ‘Aggressor’ in G7 Statement on Invasion
Summary: The American opposition to a draft of a Group of 7 statement marking the third anniversary of Russia’s attack on Ukraine comes after President Trump blamed Kyiv for starting the war.

Headline: Global Doping Authority Drops Cases Against U.S. Officials
Summary: The World Anti-Doping Agency withdrew a defamation lawsuit and an ethics case against American officials critical of its handling of failed tests by members of China’s Olympic swimming squad.

Headline: Trump Administration Abruptly Clears Out Migrants It Sent to Guantánamo
Summary: A transfer operation on Thursday repatriated 177 Venezuelans via a handoff in Honduras, while one migrant was brought back to U.S. soil.

Headline: There’s a Big Hole in England
Summary: A giant hole opened up on a street in Surrey, southwest of London, forcing evacuations and leaving a car teetering on the edge. The cause was unknown.

Headline: Holes Force Evacuations in English Village
Summary: Two large holes along a road in Surrey, England, led to the evacuation of 30 homes, according to the local council. The county declared a major incident.

Headline: Trump Elevates Kremlin Talking Points, a Familiar Pattern From His First Term
Summary: President Trump’s description of President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine as a “Dictator without Elections” echoes the Kremlin’s messaging.

Headline: Bucha Has a Question: Does Trump Remember the Russian Massacre?
Summary: Residents of a Ukrainian suburb that was the site of notorious attacks on civilians after Russia invaded are alarmed by President Trump’s warm words for Moscow.

Headline: Thanks to Trump, Saudi Arabia Gets a Big Week in International Diplomacy
Summary: Riyadh is hosting U.S., Russian and Arab officials for high-stakes talks on Ukraine and Gaza, more proof of its regional clout and warm relations with President Trump.

Headline: In Giant Chinese Embassy in London, Opponents See Long Arm of Beijing
Summary: Britain appears ready to approve what would be the largest diplomatic outpost in Europe, but neighbors and activists fear tapped phone lines and suppressed protests.

Headline: Delta Offers $30,000 to Passengers on Plane That Crashed in Toronto
Summary: The airline said it told the 76 passengers who had been on the plane, which crashed and flipped over on Monday, that the offer came with “no strings attached.”

Headline: Trump Flips the Script on the Ukraine War, Blaming Zelensky Not Putin
Summary: As he seeks to negotiate a peace deal with Moscow, President Trump is rewriting the history of Russia’s invasion of its neighbor.

Headline: Thursday Briefing: Trump and Zelensky Feud Over Peace Talks
Summary: Plus, Cambodia’s returned treasures.
